deployFromVintage(uint256).details: Deploys a TCO2 contract based on a project vintage

getContracts().details: Returns all addresses of deployed TCO2 contracts

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate that the this implementation remains valid after an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setBeacon(address).details: sets the Beacon that tracks the current implementation logic of the TCO2s

params._bridgeFeeBurnAddress: address to transfer the fees to burn

params._bridgeFeeBurnPercentageInBase: percentage of bridge fee in base

params._bridgeFeePercentageInBase: percentage of bridge fee in base

setToucanContractRegistry(address).details: set the registry contract to be tracked

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause().details: unpause the system, wraps _unpause(), only Admin

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

version().details: Returns the current version of the smart contract

addToAllowedBridges(address).notice: adds account to the allowedBridges list meant to be used only for cross-chain bridging

allowedBridges(address).notice: meant to be used only for cross-chain bridging

pause().notice: Emergency function to disable contract's core functionality

removeFromAllowedBridges(address).notice: removes account from the allowedBridges list meant to be used only for cross-chain bridging

setBridgeFeeBurnAddress(address).notice: Update the bridge fee burn address

setBridgeFeeBurnPercentage(uint256).notice: Update the bridge fee burning percentage

userdoc.notice: This TCO2 factory creates project-vintage-specific ERC20 contracts for Batch-NFT fractionalization Locks in received ERC721 Batch-NFTs and can mint corresponding quantity of ERC20s Permissionless, anyone can deploy new ERC20s unless they do not yet exist and pid exists
